title: @RiotRepertoir opinion on nidalee?
body: Hey Rep. I'm just gonna jump right in here. As i reviewed over your megathread, i didn't see too many questions asked and answered about nidalee (maybe one or two) so I'm gonna throw some q's at you. How do you feel about nidalee as she relates to her current balance state, and are there any buffs/nerfs/updates that you might be planning to make with her in the future? Personally i think her hunt mechanic is very interesting and thematically fitting to her, but at the moment it feels like her damage is significantly lackluster without a hunted target. In your opinion, how do you feel about her damage output without a hunted target vs with? on a side note I'd like to hear your thoughts on the new challenger nidalee skin coming up. Thanks in advance

replies.body:
> How do you feel about nidalee as she relates to her current balance state, and are there any buffs/nerfs/updates that you might be planning to make with her in the future?

I think she's too snowball dependent at the moment, but I can't say I have specific plans to address it until I see a bit of how her performance goes in the early season before planning changes.

> In your opinion, how do you feel about her damage output without a hunted target vs with?

Mixed feelings, really. On the one hand, I like that she gives clear indicators to opponents as to how to beat her (don't get Hunted). On the other, I think that it can also lead to her being one-dimensional. This concern could possibly be addressed by adjustments to Bushwhack to make it more useful in Hunting.

> on a side note I'd like to hear your thoughts on the new challenger nidalee skin coming up.

Pretty excited for the skin. I always like it when a champion I've worked on gets a skin, not only because they seem to just keep getting better and better, but also because it means I'm likely to see more games with the champion in it, and I like spying on my people playing my work.
But how do you feel about her being cancer?
one of the lowest win rates, last i checked (which was early preseason).  Was I think around 42%.
Winrate has nothing to do with how frustrating a champion is.
True...  Cancer usually equates to OP tho, which she is balanced if not UP rn.  But ye, she is frustrating to play against.  And sometimes as, tbh.
honestly, if you compare her now to what she used to be before the rework i think she was more cancer before Repetoir and co reworked her.

That's not really saying much, as her season 3 incarnation could constantly toss spears that had a large hitbox and took off 3/4ths of a squishy's health in a single hit. One good Nid spear back in those days turned a 5v5 into a 4v5 from a screen away.

It would not be very difficult to change a kit to be more healthy than a tomahawk missile every four seconds.

her kit is orientated to more of an assassin instead of a backline mage. nidalees power shifted from playing darts from the backline to jumping in on hunted targets. i think thats a pretty healthy power shift to me.

>
> But how do you feel about her being cancer?

I lol'd honestly.

Reminds me of when she was called "Cancer Panther" back in S3-S4.

>This concern could possibly be addressed by adjustments to Bushwhack to make it more useful in Hunting.

Nice to hear, Bushwhack feels a bit...underwhelming since the damage nerfs to it.

Some more Questions:
How do you feel about her beeing jungle only right now? Are there any plans on improving her sololane?

How do you feel about her human-E? I think the AS-buff is a bit out of place and has no connection to the rest of her kit at all.

>I think she's too snowball dependent at the moment

Ever considered reduceing her burst but giving her more survivabillity, maybe working with a short duration stealth after cougar-Q vs a haunted target rather than more damage and a heal/shield/defstat-bonus based on the number of champions(monsters?) hit on her cougar E(maybe doubled vs haunted targets)?
My biggest issue with her atm is that jumping in as cougar is prettymuch suicide unless you straigh up kill your target, as she is so damn squishy and her escape-W doesn't really get her out of harms way usually. This leads to the hard snowballing, as either i have the damage to oneshot someone, or i can't go in at all.

rush zhonyas and buy offensively defensive items like abyssal and dead mans is sleeper op on nidalee. but i agree. she needs something to survive teamfights. i think she would be great to have her bonus armor and mr with cougar form back.

IMO, the AS buff on her E isn't out of place.  Her lore says, basically, that she became one with nature and got her powers from mother earth [correct me if im wrong, but thats how i remember it.]  The AS buff/heal is basically her using the earths power to grant herself/an ally life/power.  On top of that, it works REALLY well with her late game, considering shes the opposite of Karma support (supp early game, mage late game for Karma --- assassin early game, support late game for Nidalee).  Her spears still chunk like a mofo, but she typically can't rip people to shreds in cougar form like she can early-mid game.
